title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
Hi,
Received the MacBook in for non-responsive keyboard. Upon inspection, Unit was fully working with the external keyboard. It would accept keyboard shortcuts at boot but nothing once we were in os. We found quite a few places with liquid residue. Put it through cleanup in crest ultrasonic cleaner. It will not power on now, no chime, no backlight no spin. I have 3rd party charger that goes green when plugged.
Had a look under a microscope and nothing pops out.
Please advise

Kind regards,

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
Remove keyboard and connect magsafe; does it turn on?

Be aware of ultrasonic cleaners w/o sweep function.
Change the board position every 30s and do not let it more than 10min total in the bath.

Post some voltages in the U7100 and Q7010 areas.
Check if D7010 is still in place.

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
I tried with speaker and fan only. I might have messed it up as it was definitely longer than 10 min but my crest has a sweeping function, its the recommended one for those jobs. D7010 present. C7101 is 5.45v C7100 same C7105 16.45V, C7122 14.33v, C7120 0v those are around U7100.
C7012 8.15v ( i am guessing the component here as my board view is a bit different to the board I have) that's the only cap I found around the Q7010.

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: Post PPBUS_G3H and 3V42 voltages you get.

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
PPBUS_G3H  12.5v, 3V42 3.4v
Checked each in 2 different points

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
3V3_SUS, 3V3_S5?
5V_S3 pulsing at least?

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: Yeah post voltages for PPVRTC_G3H, PP5v_S5, PP3v3_S5, PP3v3_SUS, and PP5v_S4. If you have all of those, then check for PP5v_S3 like 2informaticos asked for

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
All 3.3 lines have 3.3v
I am getting 4.9v on c7505 that's part of PP5V_S5, but 0v on two components on PP5v_S4, PP5v_S3 also 0v

Those checks I do with only power connected, The light on the charger switches from green to amber and back to green in 10 sec intervals

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
"5V_S3 pulsing at least?"
You can also check if PM_SLP_S4_L pulse once, or every 5sec.
If not, post SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_BATLOW_L, PM_RSMRST_L.

Does PM_PWRBTN_L react if you trigger SMC_ONOFF_L?
If not, check all PCH's RTC signal, and 32KHz clock from U1900.

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
Unfortunately, I don't have an oscilloscope :( I believe I would need it to see the pulsing?
Just a multimeter to use
I am not totally new but still learning.
The multimeter doesn't pick up any voltage
SMC_ADAPTER_EN 3.37v
PM_BATLOW_L 0.03v
PM_RSMRST_L 3.28v

I am hoping it is still possible to assess the board without the oscilloscope 

Not sure how to trigger the SMC_ONOFF_L, it seems to be on 3.4v all the time unless I am doing something wrong
PM_PWRBTN_L also constantly on 3.4v

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
"Not sure how to trigger the SMC_ONOFF_L, it seems to be on 3.4v all the time"
Force it 1s to ground, like pressing power button; use R5115/16 pads.

"PM_BATLOW_L 0.03v"
PCH will not start Power On Sequence then...
Did you try original 85W charger?

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
Thanks for all the help

After triggering, PM_PWRBTN_L jumped from 3.4v to 2.6v and back to 3.4v
I am testing without the battery being plugged in - not sure if that matters
Just tried plugging it in with an original 45w charger and battery/fan/speaker. Got a chime but no fan spin so I disconnected it - not sure if that helps

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
The fan starts later on this board, when something gets hot...
Do you have USB activity?
Also check for image, even if no backlight present.

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: Yeah the fan doesn't spin on this model until the CPU heats up. Light on USB mouse with the chime? If so exactly what 2informaticos said check for image.

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: Ok, it started up, somehow it starts up now. Get the picture, black screen "question mark folder", doesn't see the disk for some reason, the keyboard also doesn't work. I tried the ssd in another mac and its booting and loading os so it must be something to do with the motherboard. Should I start another topic? or can I continue here?

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
Continue here...
Keyboard/trackpad work in boot menu and don't work under OSX?
Check traces around SSD connector; post voltages (with SSD inserted) for U3740.

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
the U3740 pin1 - 3.4v, pin 2 - 0v, pin 8 - 0.08v, (I checked those when plugged but not on)
The keyboard seems to be completely unresponsive now, apart of the power button, no trackpad either

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: btw, I just noticed that L2920 is a bit chipped not much thou

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
Need voltage at J3470 when board is on.
You cannot access boot menu even?

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: Sorry, I could find the J3470, neither on the schematics nor in BoardView, I am obviously missing something. I had to plug in the external keyboard to Alt boot, internal keyboard didn't let me do that

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: J3700 i think! Let me check it now

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: [URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/41437-820-4924-a-wont-turn-on?_=1540920153704&_=1540923541988"]3[/URL].3v on the J3700 PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FLT I hope that is the one.

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: Sorry, my mistake; read U3740 instead of J3740...

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
U3740

Pin 1 3.4v , Pin 2 0.98V, Pin 6 3.22v
While on

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: What about the other pins???

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message: sorry, Pin 3 - 3.28v, pin 4 - 3.43, pin 5 - 0v,  pin 7 - 0.022v, pin 8 - 0.993v

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
Strange to have 1V at SSD_CLKREQ_L.
I think PCH cannot recognize the signal.
Low level should be less than 0.8V in theory...
Change U3740 and see what happens.

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
Hi

Swapped U3740, Pin 8 is now 0v, Pin 6 3.15v other pins are the same, still the same outcome :/

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
So U3740 was bad.
Check again control signals and power rails at J3700.
Pay atention at continuity between J3700.and U3710/11; maybe need to change them too.
Did you try known good SSD again?

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
apologies, there are other differences on the U3740
Pin 1 3.43v
Pin 2 0.994v
Pin 3 3.288v
Pin 4 0v
Pin 5 GN
Pin 6 3.25v
Pin 7 starts at 1v and slowly goes down
Pin 8 0v

Maybe I didn't do it right?


J3700

Pin 1 3.33v
other power pins share this power line it seems.
I am sorry to be so ignorant, how would I recognize pins for control signals? How would I test them?

I went through every pin on J3700 and there doesn't seem to be a direct connection to U3710/11 so that I could test the continuity, I am guessing I am doing it wrong

This SSD works in another MacBook so I don't think its the SSD

Thank you for your patience and the assistance

title: 820-4924-a wont turn on
message:
"Pin 4 0v"
That is bad; SSD is kept in reset...
You should get 3V at both pins 3 & 4.
